pullRequest.title: utility command to help search for available keyboard shortcuts
pullRequest.bodyText:
Toggle via Help / Diagnostics / Short Keyboard Shortcut Command
When on, a message bar is shown at bottom of main window, and any shortcuts typed will report their bound command (or "Shortcut not bound") but not fire the command
Shows mappings even if command is currently disabled
Could be the basis of a "real" feature (what does this shortcut do), and as a bonus it will read the results via screen reader due to message bar being a live region, but for now just considering a dev tool
Doesn't account for platform differences (Windows vs Mac vs Linux, desktop vs browser), so there are some edge cases you won't catch unless you try on all those, or at least double-check in commands.cmd.xml
When you turn off this mode, it hides the warning bar for you

commit.message:
utility command to help search for available keyboard shortcuts

- Toggle via Help / Diagnostics / Short Keyboard Shortcut Command
- When on, a message bar is shown at bottom of main window, and any shortcuts typed will report their bound command (or "Shortcut not bound") but not fire the command
- Shows mappings even if command is currently disabled
- Could be the basis of a "real" feature (what does this shortcut do), and as a bonus it will read the results via screen reader due to message bar being a live region, but for now just considering a dev tool
- Doesn't account for platform differences (Windows vs Mac vs Linux, desktop vs browser), so there are some edge cases you won't catch unless you try on all those, or at least double-check in commands.cmd.xml
- When you turn off this mode, it hides the warning bar for you

nodes.bodyText: I think that it should be clearer whether we're at leaf node in the shortcut tree (i.e. if you have a shortcut that uses C-X as a prefix, C-X should show that it's putting us in pending mode rather than reporting C-X as totally unbound)

When unchecked, checkable menu items look exactly like regular menu items so I don't think most people will know the first time that they invoke this mode that they need to go back to the menu to turn it off.
I think that this should either be (a) self-cancelling (it just reports one shortcut and quits) or advertise a way to quit in the message itself (a special shortcut or a reference to the menu item).

commit.message:
tweaks based on PR feedback

- instead of using a checkbox menu-item to toggle on/off, closing the messagebar will exit this mode
- show a message when shortcut resolution still pending (e.g. multi-gesture shortcuts)
- cleanup ShowWarningBarEvent to use our single-file model instead of separate Event, Handler, Data source files
clear pending message after timeout, put back original instructions
